ygData.subject: RE: Memory Blur
ygData.msgSnippet: I know that now, but, you never know til you try. We had been handling red griffennes so easily that it was boring. Those two are the next step up in the food
ygData.messageBody:
I know that now, but, you never know til you try. We had been handling red
griffennes so easily that it was boring. Those two are the next step up in
the food chain in North Karana...

-Qinie Isil'Goren, High Elf Enchantress

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Silverlock [SMTP:croesus@...]
> Sent: Thursday, July 29, 1999 12:38 AM
> To: eqenchanters@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [eqenchanters] Memory Blur
>
> From: Silverlock <croesus@...>
>
> At 04:28 PM 7/28/99 -0500, you wrote:
>
> First of all you are silly to have tried a Hill giant and a Griffon, both
> levle 35 mobs with a party full of mid 20's characters. Nothing you throw
> will ever stick to a deep red, relative levels matters far more then magic
> resistance or tashani. Other then that yes to use memory blur you need to
> make sure the mob is outside of the agro range.
>
>
> >From: "Farr, Robert" <robert.farr@...>
> >
> >I used memory blur for the first time last night and I have some
> questions.
> >
> >My party and I decided to try and tackle a hill giant. With all of us
> having
> >SoW and me having Memory Blur (MB) we didn't think we'd have a problem,
> even
> >though we are all low-mid 20's. Well, we couldn't touch that hill giant
> with
> >spells even after my tashani. The tank was hysterical and wouldn't run
> close
> >enough for me to get off a MB to get the giant off him. In the end,
> everyone
> >but me zoned, so the hill giant comes straight for me. I start pushing
> the
> >MB key... Target out of range!... Target out of range!... You begin to
> cast
> >a spell.... A hill giant blinks. The hill giant then changed direction
> and
> >went about his merry way. Cool!
> >
> >Now that we know we can't take a hill giant, and bolstered by our
> experience
> >with the hill giant (noone died), we decided to try a griffon. This one
> >didn't go nearly as well. The griffon turned out to be just as magic
> >resistant as the hill giant, and a LOT faster. After unsuccessfully
> trying
> >our spells, the call went out for MB. The tank ran the griff near me and
> I
> >cast MB. A griffon blinks. Problem was, it kept chasing the tank! The
> tank
> >didn't like that news so he kept running for the zone. I chased him a bit
> to
> >try and get another cast of MB off. I guess at that point I was closer to
> >the griffon than the tank because it turned for me.
> >
> >You begin to cast a spell.
> >A griffon claws you for 96 points of damage!
> >A griffon claws you for 96 points of damage!
> >A griffon kicks you for 34 points of damage!
> >You keep your concentration and finish the spell! (don't know how...)
> >A griffin blinks.
> >A griffon claws you for 78 points of damage!
> >A griffon claws you for 89 points of damage!
> >A griffon bashes you for 28 points of damage!
> >You are stunned!
> >You cannot cast spells while stunned!
> >You cannot cast spells while stunned!
> >You cannot cast spells while stunned!
> >You cannot cast spells while stunned!
> >A griffin claws you for 56 points of damage!
> >A griffon kicks you for 32 points of damage!
> >You have been slain by a griffon!
> >
> >The question I have is, what is the correct way to use MB? Apparently, it
> >wipes the hate list, but if you are in the critter's aggro radius the
> >critter will just jump you again. Anyone have any strategies to share in
> >using Memory Blur?
> >

> >Drawing is held each week through August 20. For details, go to
> >http://www.onelist.com/info/onereachsplash3.html
